snippet: Russia said on Monday that its “volunteer” ground forces would be deployed, a move that could fundamentally alter the Syrian war.
abstract: Russia says its 'volunteer' ground troops will fight in Syria in war against Islamic State, while NATO warns country after at least one Russian jet trespasses into Turkey's airspace; tensions increase with United States as speculation mounts over whether Russia will start ground offensive against Syrian rebels, not affiliated with ISIS, who oppose Russian ally Pres Bashar al-Assad.

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Moscow, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Reporting was contributed by Helene Cooper from Madrid, Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul, Eric Schmitt from Washington, Maher Samaan from Beirut, and Somini Sengupta and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Russia said on Monday that its “volunteer” ground forces would be deployed, a move that could fundamentally alter the Syrian war.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
